channel.title: technology on CipherBlog
channel.description: Recent content in technology on CipherBlog

item.title: What are Web Cookies?
item.description: Here’s a quick read. Cookies are small text files websites set on your browser when you visit them. These files hold pieces of labeled data such as username and password. Here’s an example of a cookie file. 1 2 3 username="some random username" password="super complex password" last_login=1675604361 When you close the website and revisit the site again, that site can read the cookie file it stored earlier and apply settings you set earlier.

item.title: Markdown and Future Proofing Documents
item.description: Markdown is the simplest text markup language other than gemini. I would not be incorrect if I say markdown will only be second to gemtext and plain .txt text files in terms of simplicity. Unfortunately, there are more people who don’t even know what markdown is than the people who know. Jump directly to markdown cheatsheet If you want to take some notes during a lecture or during a presentation etc, your note will mostly be plain text.
